WorkItem.Description:
If you take the following oracle query:
 
select 'Hello' as "Hello.Bug" from dual
 
Get this query into a dataset. 
 
And our XAML is
<my:DataGrid AutoGenerateColumns="true" Name="myGrid" ItemsSource="{Binding}"/>
 
Then assign:
 
myGrid.DataContext = ds.Tables[0].DefaultView;
 
I would expect to see
"Hello" 
 
but you see:
 
Plain nothing. In output you see the error message:
 
"System.Windows.Data Error: 39 : BindingExpression path error: 'Bug' property not found on 'object' ''DataRowView'"
WorkItem.Summary: Grid doesn't display columns with "." in columnname

Comments.Message: Thought I would chime in and say that I have the same issue.  I am using PropertyDescriptors to auto generate columns for my multi-dimensional array that I am data binding to.  If my column names have a "." in them, the values of the datagrid are not populated.
